did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Architectural plans, manuscripts, photographs, and printed materials.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Two volumes of lecture notes; two publications, "Vaults" and "Pendentives and other Devices". A typescript outline "Architectural Methods of Covering Spaces" and a typescript describing the making of a bust of Professor Babcock and a photo of the bust as well as a cabinet card portrait of Babcock. Drawings of Lincoln Hall and plan of Sage College.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Two volumes of lecture notes entitled "Ancient Architecture" and "Romanesque and Byzantine"; two publications, "Vaults" (20 pp.) and "Pendentives and other Devices" (3 pp.); and a typescript outline "Architectural Methods of Covering Spaces" (2 pp.). Also, a typescript describing the making of a bust of Professor Babcock and a photo of the bust, a cabinet card portrait of Babcock, and a note from him to Frederick W. Field (1895). Drawings of Lincoln Hall (1904). June 15, 1872, Plan of Sage College, no. 11, Section, through center, looking North.
Also, "Freely Given: the story of a Sparkill landmark and its famous architect," published by Christ Episcopal Church, Sparkill, N.Y., 2011.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Charles E. Babcock papers, #15-5-1626. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Collection consists of one box and one oversize folder. Online guide unavailable.
